collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (23 total Queries, 23 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. (a) Obtain schedule of revenue <strong>(P)</strong></p> <p>(b) Ensure that revenue is analysed based on class of business and geographical market. Ensure the analysis of revenue also separately identifies the following:-</p> <ul> <li>Income from the sale of goods;</li> <li>Income from the rendering of services; and</li> <li>Income from undertaking construction contracts. <strong>(P)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Agree total shown on the lead schedule to the trial balance. <strong>(A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Ensure the accounting policies for revenue comply with the requirements of IFRS 15. <strong>(C, A, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Review revenue for reasonableness and consistency, including any statutory disclosures given. <strong>(C, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Calculate the gross profit percentage, disaggregated as far as possible, and compare to the previous period. Analyse and verify any unexpected change. <strong>(C, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Consider the results of the scrutiny tests completed in the F section. <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Walkthrough</h6>\r\n<p>11. Undertake one walkthrough test for each system in operation (this must cover the transaction and associated controls). Use the results, along with results of receivables’ testing, to decide whether to replace some or all tests of detail with detailed analytical procedures. <strong>(A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Detailed analytical procedures</h6>\r\n<p>12. Perform detailed analytical procedures as applicable to the client. E.g. proof in total, ratio analysis (comparing periods and similar entities). <strong>(C, CL, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Tests of detail</h6>\r\n<p>13. Trace a sample of items from the ‘point of inception’ (e.g. contract, order, timesheet or dispatch document) through to sales invoices, then to the sales day book and then to the sales ledger and nominal ledger. <strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. For cash sales, trace a sample of takings from till records (rolls or internal electronic logs) through to cashbook receipts banked.<strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. For a sample of entries in the sales nominal ledger account agree them back to documents that support their inception.<strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Where income is contingent on future events (such as “no win no fee scenarios”), review a sample of contracts on a portfolio basis to determine whether the recognition of revenue is appropriate <strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. For a sample of sales invoices, check </p> <ul> <li>selling prices;</li> <li>treatment of discounts;</li> <li>casts and extensions. <strong>(O, C, A)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Confirm that sales taxes have been excluded from the amount which has been recorded in the sales nominal ledger account. <strong>(A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Check the sales day book casts. <strong>(A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Where sales credit notes are material, confirm that they are correctly authorised and represent valid credits. <strong>(C, A, CO)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Check the accuracy of the analysis of revenue noted on the lead schedule by agreeing to nominal ledger analysis and test a sample of entries in the nominal ledger accounts to underlying invoices to confirm appropriate allocation .<strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>22. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.1 O2', '2.13.1 O2', '31', 'Active', '2024-03-21 19:57:06')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	(a) Obtain schedule of revenue <strong>(P)</strong></p>
<p>(b) Ensure that revenue is analysed based on class of business and geographical market.  Ensure the analysis of revenue also separately identifies the following:-</p>
<ul>
    <li>Income from the sale of goods;</li>
    <li>Income from the rendering of services; and</li>
    <li>Income from undertaking construction contracts. <strong>(P)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [1] => <p>2.	Agree total shown on the lead schedule to the trial balance. <strong>(A)</strong></p>
    [2] => <p>3.	Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [3] => <p>4.	Ensure the accounting policies for revenue comply with the requirements of IFRS 15.  <strong>(C, A, P)</strong></p>
    [4] => <p>5.	Review revenue for reasonableness and consistency, including any statutory disclosures given. <strong>(C, P)</strong></p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>
    [6] => <p>7.	Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>
    [7] => <p>8.	Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [8] => <p>9.	Calculate the gross profit percentage, disaggregated as far as possible, and compare to the previous period.  Analyse and verify any unexpected change. <strong>(C, A)</strong></p>
    [9] => <p>10.	Consider the results of the scrutiny tests completed in the F section. <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>
    [10] => <h6>Walkthrough</h6>
<p>11.	Undertake one walkthrough test for each system in operation (this must cover the transaction and associated controls).  Use the results, along with results of receivables’ testing, to decide whether to replace some or all tests of detail with detailed analytical procedures. <strong>(A)</strong></p>
    [11] => <h6>Detailed analytical procedures</h6>
<p>12.	Perform detailed analytical procedures as applicable to the client.  E.g. proof in total, ratio analysis (comparing periods and similar entities). <strong>(C, CL, A)</strong></p>
    [12] => <h6>Tests of detail</h6>
<p>13.	Trace a sample of items from the ‘point of inception’ (e.g. contract, order, timesheet or dispatch document) through to sales invoices, then to the sales day book and then to the sales ledger and nominal ledger. <strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>
    [13] => <p>14.	For cash sales, trace a sample of takings from till records (rolls or internal electronic logs) through to cashbook receipts banked.<strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>
    [14] => <p>15.	For a sample of entries in the sales nominal ledger account agree them back to documents that support their inception.<strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>
    [15] => <p>16.	Where income is contingent on future events (such as “no win no fee scenarios”), review a sample of contracts on a portfolio basis to determine whether the recognition of revenue is appropriate <strong>(O, C, A)</strong></p>
    [16] => <p>17.	For a sample of sales invoices, check </p>
<ul>
    <li>selling prices;</li>
    <li>treatment of discounts;</li>
    <li>casts and extensions. <strong>(O, C, A)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [17] => <p>18.	Confirm that sales taxes have been excluded from the amount which has been recorded in the sales nominal ledger account. <strong>(A)</strong></p>
    [18] => <p>19.	Check the sales day book casts.  <strong>(A)</strong></p>
    [19] => <p>20.	Where sales credit notes are material, confirm that they are correctly authorised and represent valid credits. <strong>(C, A, CO)</strong></p>
    [20] => <p>21.	Check the accuracy of the analysis of revenue noted on the lead schedule by agreeing to nominal ledger analysis and test a sample of entries in the nominal ledger accounts to underlying invoices to confirm appropriate allocation .<strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [21] => <p>22.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)
